ThingDef.label: sparrow
ThingDef.description: Small birds that often travel in flocks. They can thrive in a variety of environments.

ThingDef.label: crow
ThingDef.description: Intelligent black birds with complex social structures. With a little patience, crows can be trained to perform a number of fairly complex tasks.

ThingDef.label: bluebird
ThingDef.description: A small songbird with vibrant blue plumage.

ThingDef.label: quail
ThingDef.description: Small plump ground-dwelling birds with a distinctive plume.

ThingDef.label: macaw
ThingDef.description: A parrot known for its intelligence and its brilliant plumage.

ThingDef.label: flamingo
ThingDef.description: A wading bird known for their vibrant pink plumage. Their long legs are well adapted to shallow waters.

ThingDef.label: heron
ThingDef.description: Long-legged and long-necked birds. They tend to live in marshy habitats.

ThingDef.label: swan
ThingDef.description: Large graceful waterfowl known for their beauty, and their surprising ferocity.

ThingDef.label: peacock
ThingDef.description: Large birds with extravagant plumage. Male peacocks use their tail feathers in elaborate courtship displays.

ThingDef.label: vulture
ThingDef.description: Scavengers with strong beaks and broad wings. Their strong stomach acid allows them to eat rotting corpses.

ThingDef.label: penguin
ThingDef.description: A flightless bird adept at surviving in cold regions. Their black and white plumage and waddling gait make them unmistakable. They are deadly hunters in the water, but slow and vulnerable on land.
